newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PLDT jumps 5.17 pct in early trade.
newsitem.headline: PLDT jumps 5.17 pct in early trade.

text.p: Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co climbed 45 pesos, or 5.17 percent, to 915 pesos in early Friday trade following the gains registered by its American Depositary Receipt (ADR), brokers said.
"PLDT was up significantly in New York taking its cue from the Dow which gained 100 points overnight," said Helen Alvarez, research director at All Asia Securities.
One broker said talk of the peso weakening sharply after Thailand's financial woes also led to a rise in prices of shares heavily dependent on dollar-denominated revenues which includes PLDT.
International calls contribute largely to PLDT's earnings.
Some 114.49 million pesos worth of PLDT shares changed hands in early session.
